text: Herb–drug interactions strongly challenge the clinical combined application of herbs and drugs.
Herbal products consist of complex pharmacological-active ingredients and perturb the activity of drug-metabolizing enzymes.
label: Herb name
Parameter

text: Panax notoginseng saponins (PNS)-based drugs are often combined with aspirin in vascular disease treatment in China.
label: Herb name
Drug

text: PNS was found to exhibit inhibitory effects on aspirin hydrolysis using Caco-2 cell monolayers.
label: Herb name

text: In the present study, a total of 22 components of PNS were separated and identified by UPLC-MS/MS.
label: Herb name

text: Using highly selective probe substrate analysis, PNS exerted robust inhibitory potency on human carboxylesterase 2 (hCE2), while had a minor influence on hCE1, butyrylcholinesterase (BChE) and paraoxonase (PON).

text: Herbs have been used for primary health care for thousands of years before the advent of modern medicines.
label: Herb name
Duration

text: It is estimated that approximately 80% of the population in Asian countries currently uses herbs as complementary or alternative medicine [1].
label: Ethnic group
Herb name

text: Patients in these countries with complex diseases use herbs more frequently.
label: Pathology
Herb name

text: However, side effects of herb-drug interactions (HDI) might occur.
Some research reported that herbs perturbed the activities of the metabolizing enzymes and/or transporters [2,3,4].
label: Herb name
Parameter

text: In the past decades, concerns about HDI have been raised.
Liver is the primary drug metabolism site and entails a myriad of chemical reactions.
HepaRG cell line, derived from a hepatocellular carcinoma, could express a large panel of liver-specific enzymes [5,6,7].
label: Pathology
Parameter

text: Due to the similarity with primary human hepatocytes, HepaRG cell line was found to be a valuable human-relevant in vitro model for testing drug interactions [8].
Panax notoginseng saponins (PNS) are the main biologically active constituents in the roots of Panax notoginseng (family Araliaceae).
label: Herb name
Herb part
Herb name

text: In China, PNS-based drugs have been developed and widely used to treat cerebral infarction and ischemia [9], coronary heart disease and atherosclerosis [10].
label: Herb name
Pathology

text: Aspirin (acetylsalicylic acid) is an important member of the therapeutic arsenal for combating the vascular disease.
label: Drug
Pathology

text: After administration, aspirin is rapidly hydrolyzed in the body with an elimination half-life of approximatly 15 min [11,12].
label: Drug
Parameter
Duration

text: Aspirin and PNS-based drugs are often taken together to prevent thrombus and clinical benefits have been obtained.
label: Drug
Herb name
Pathology

text: On account of the presence of ester bond, aspirin could be catalyzed by esterases in the intestine, liver, and plasma [13], which mainly include human carboxylesterase 1 (hCE1) and hCE2 in the liver and intestine [14,15], and butyrylcholinesterase (BChE) [16], paraoxonase (PON) [17,18] in plasma.
label: Drug

text: We recently reported that PNS could inhibit aspirin hydrolysis and thereby elevated the level of aspirin through Caco-2 cell monolayers [19].
label: Herb name

text: In the current study, we characterized the effects of PNS on the esterases using highly selective probe substrates and predicted the potential HDI in vivo on the basis of enzyme kinetic parameters of hCE2.

text: Multi-drug therapy is now a common therapeutic practice for patients due to their therapeutic benefits, in both developed and developing countries.
As a consequence, drug interactions are sometimes unavoidable.
Apart from cytochrome P450, esterases is an important class of phase I metabolic enzymes, and plays a vital role in the biotransformation of ester-linked compounds.
label: Parameter
Parameter

text: Drugs with the ability to inhibit the catalytic activity of esterases in the body might improve systemic exposure of the drug which is primarily cleared via the esterases.
label: Parameter
Target
Parameter

text: Except for synthetic compounds, many natural triterpenoids have been reported to exhibit the potent inhibitory effects on esterases in recent years [21,22,23].
label: Herb name
Target

text: Aspirin is one of the oldest antiplatelet agents used for antithrombotic therapy.
label: Drug
Drug

text: It is rapidly hydrolyzed to salicylic acid by esterases in the body.
label: Drug
Parameter

text: Compared with other esterases, it has been reported that aspirin was primarily hydrolyzed by hCE2 [15].
label: Parameter
Drug
Parameter

text: In China, aspirin and PNS-based drugs are often taken together under many conditions and produce enhanced therapeutic effects.
label: Drug
Herb name

text: In our previous study, the plasma concentration of salicylic acid was highly increased when PNS and aspirin were co-administrated in SD rats, indicating that the HDI in vivo definitely existed in both drugs [24].

text: In addition, using Caco-2 cell monolayers model, we demonstrated that PNS exhibited appreciative inhibitory ability on the activity of the esterases responsible for aspirin hydrolysis, resulting in the elevated level of aspirin across Caco-2 cell monolayers [19].

text: Highly-selective probe substrate analysis is extensively used for determination of the inhibitory potential of a test compound.

The basic premise of the methodology is that if test compounds cannot inhibit a particular metabolic enzyme, the probe substrate will be metabolized to its product (metabolite) which can then be measured.
label: Parameter

text: Conversely, if test compounds inhibit the enzyme, the substrate will not be metabolized or the rate of biotransformation and the formation of product declines [25].
label: Target

text: In the study, we used probe substrate analysis to explore the inhibitory effects of PNS toward esterases.
label: Herb name
Target
